assessments.status_rationale: Today’s items include Cuba fuel shortages and broader U.S. pressure but do not report any new/amended OFAC Venezuela-related General License expanding authorization for oil/gas transactions with PDVSA or other state-linked Venezuelan entities.
Coverage notes the Nikkei 225 continuing a post-election rally, but provides no evidence of a daily close at or above 45,000; the threshold event is not documented here.
No news bullet indicates Thailand declaring a state of emergency (or equivalent) covering Bangkok due to post-election unrest.

There is reporting on large-volume sports prediction-market trading around the Super Bowl, but no indication of a CFTC formal public action (order/settlement/no-action withdrawal/rulemaking notice) explicitly addressing sports-event prediction markets.
No bullet references a CFPB advisory/circular/supervisory highlight/enforcement action specifically focused on generative-AI-driven financial advice or retirement planning.
No report today indicates Microsoft has issued a security advisory and shipped Windows updates mitigating a UEFI Secure Boot bypass involving signed bootloaders with an associated CVE.

Today’s bullets include Epstein-related reporting and other U.S. political/legal items, but nothing about a new U.S. State Department visa restriction or sanction targeting Hong Kong/PRC officials citing Jimmy Lai sentencing or Hong Kong political prosecutions.

While there is fresh Epstein-related reporting, there is no evidence here of a U.S. House standing committee holding a public hearing explicitly discussing conflicts-of-interest/governance concerns related to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and referencing Epstein records reporting.
